cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles north of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the Bahamas, then forecast to turn northwest toward southern Florida this weekend and curve north-northwest inland across Georgia early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida (Florida Keys or southwest Florida coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Georgia coastline at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Georgia coastline at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from the Florida Keys northward to the Georgia and South Carolina coasts is expected to feel impacts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely (58% chance) with a 27% chance of 50-kt winds and a 12% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds at Savannah. Peak winds expected late Monday as the storm core moves inland to the west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: On-shore flow ahead of Irma could push 3–5 ft of surge into the Georgia coast and the Savannah River entrance, especially if the center tracks just inland.
weather_observation.rainfall: NHC forecasts 3–6 inches with isolated amounts up to 10 inches across coastal Georgia; totals at Savannah likely exceed the 4-inch threshold and may produce flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough surf, dangerous rip currents, and possible minor coastal erosion beginning this weekend; port operations may also be hindered by river flooding upstream.
